Multiplicity.origin: [ does not require dismissal of the indictment "W. R. LaFave and J. H. Israel"]

1 a.definition: the quality or state of being multiple or various

sub_terms.b: the charging of a single criminal act or offense as multiple separate charges or counts of an indictment or information [ does not require dismissal of the indictment "W. R. LaFave and J. H. Israel"] compare,

1 a.note: Multiplicity raises the risk of violating the double jeopardy protection against receiving multiple sentences for a single offense. Multiplicity is a defect that can be corrected without dismissal of the case.

2.definition: a great number [joinder is allowed to avoid a of actions]
